thread.title: 6 U.S. service members killed in Afghanistan plane crash
thread.title_full: 6 U.S. service members killed in Afghanistan plane crash | OregonLive.com

author: Leada Gore | lgore@al.com
title: 6 U.S. service members killed in Afghanistan plane crash
text:
Six U.S. service personnel are among 11 people killed in a plane crash in Afghanistan.
The American fatalities were crew members for a U.S. Air Force C-130 transport plane, according to a 455th Air Expeditionary Wing news release. In all, 11 people on board the plane were killed when it crashed around midnight local time at Jalalabad Airfield in eastern Afghanistan.
The plane was assigned to the 774th Expeditionary Airlift Squadron, part of the 455th Air Expeditionary Wing.
The Jalalabad Airfield has been the site of attacks by militants in the past but there's no indication the plane was under fire at the time of the incident.
The names of those killed in the incident have not been released by the Pentagon.
Before today's crash, 13 U.S. service members have been killed in Afghanistan since the start of the year. More than 2,360 American military personnel have died since the start of hostilities since 2001.
